intro: Pavetta urophylla subsp. bosii, commonly known as the red-veined pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, often fragrant flowers. The species has lance-shaped leaves with prominent red veins, giving it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The plant produces small, clustered fruits that are dispersed by animals, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
